method.name: Clas-iRProp+

reference.ref: C. Igel and M. Husken. Empirical evaluation of the improved Rprop learning algorithm. Neurocomputing, 50(C):105--123, 2003.

generalDescription.type: Classification model by means of Neural Networks (Multilayer Perceptron or Product Unit Neural Networks) trained with the iRProp+ algorithm
generalDescription.objective: To determine a classification model with neural networks based on product unit basis functions.
generalDescription.howWork: The method consists of optimizing the value of the model coefficients with the IRProp+ algorithm, minimizing the MSE with respect the training data. In this way the Product Unit neural network model is obtained from the training set and then checked against the patterns of the generalization set.

parameterSpec.param: Hidden_Nodes: It's the number of neurons in hidden layer
Epochs: It's the maximum number of propagations of the iRProp+ algorithm
Transfer: Type of hidden neurons (Sigmoidal Unit for Multilayer_Perceptron or Product_Unit for Product Unit Neural Networks)

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: Clas-NNEP Dataset: pima Training set: pima-10-1tra.dat Test set: pima-10-1tst.dat Test Show results: Vis-Clas-Check
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the Experiment\results\Vis-Clas-Check\TSTClas-iRProp+ folder the classification results for the test set: Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.2303560474613106 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.04372558229939198 Correctly classified: 0.7696439525386893 Global N/C: 0.0
We can see too the output and target classes for each case of the test set (result0s0.tst) in Experiment\results\Clas-iRProp+\pima:
@relation pima_diabetes @attribute preg real[0.0,17.0] @attribute plas real[0.0,199.0] @attribute pres real[0.0,122.0] @attribute skin real[0.0,99.0] @attribute insu real[0.0,846.0] @attribute mass
